nodes.text: On point, do you disagree that it should be the Navy's role to make the sea lanes safe for merchant shipping?

Yes I disagree with that point. The navy, just like the police, can't possibly be everywhere that danger might raise its ugly head. Merchant ships can't afford a 24/7 navy escort anymore than the average citizen can afford to hire body guards 24/7. There's no legitimate reason why merchant ships should be unarmed and unable to address dangers that deliberately come after them.
The navy, just like the police, can't possibly be everywhere that danger might raise its ugly head.
And like the police , the Navy could plan and execute raids.

And like the police , the Navy could plan and execute raids.  Maybe escorts aren't the way to go.  I haven't suggested they should. I am suggesting that other solutions might be more effective and less dangerous to merchant crews.
Oh thats not politically kerect and secially wif the chosen one doing the world apology toure I don't see that going down.  Well lay a few on us sin baby. Give us the deal.
